option.name: content
option.value:
# Commit Message Guidelines
## The First Line - Write in simple, natural English - Capture the main change in one clear sentence - Try to be specific as possible - Keep it concise and direct - No very technical jargon or abbreviations or complex words - Keep it human-readable and focus on what actually changed.
## Additional Details (Optional) - Leave one empty line after the first line - Add context, reasoning, or implementation details - Explain the "why" behind the change - Include any breaking changes or important notes

list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Implement StateMachine for Strategy state management
- Add strategy_state_machine.py with StrategyState, StrategyAction enums and factory - Replace manual state management with StateMachine in Strategy and TradingEngine - Use descriptive action names (ADD_STRATEGY_TO_ENGINE, START_STRATEGY, etc.) - Remove old strategy_state.py file - Improve error messages with valid actions context

task.summary: Default task

Add `is_historical` flag to `NewBarEvent` for data context handling
Enhance `NewBarEvent` with a new `is_historical` attribute to distinguish between historical and live bar data. Update the initializer, properties, equality comparison, and string representations to incorporate this flag.

Add `is_historical` flag to `NewBarEvent` for data context handling
Enhance `NewBarEvent` with a new `is_historical` attribute to distinguish between historical and live bar data. Update the initializer, properties, equality comparison, and string representations to incorporate this flag.

Add `is_historical` flag to `NewBarEvent` for data context handling
Enhance `NewBarEvent` with a new `is_historical` attribute to distinguish between historical and live bar data. Update the initializer, properties, equality comparison, and string representations to incorporate this flag.

Update `.junie/guidelines.md` to include multi-line parameter formatting rules
Add guidelines for adding trailing commas in multi-line parameter lists and ensuring proper formatting for long function names. Include examples to demonstrate the updated principles.

Define `MarketDataProvider` protocol and document methods
Introduce `MarketDataProvider` protocol as a unified interface for market data retrieval and subscription. Add detailed method definitions for connection management, historical bar data handling, live bar subscriptions, and seamless historical-to-live transitions. Update `TODO.md` and `TODO_steps.md` to reflect these enhancements and provide in-depth documentation.

Define `MarketDataProvider` protocol and document methods
Introduce `MarketDataProvider` protocol as a unified interface for market data retrieval and subscription. Add detailed method definitions for connection management, historical bar data handling, live bar subscriptions, and seamless historical-to-live transitions. Update `TODO.md` and `TODO_steps.md` to reflect these enhancements and provide in-depth documentation.

Define `Broker` protocol and document core brokerage operations
Introduce `Broker` protocol as a standardized interface for handling trading operations, including connection management, order execution, order modification, and position tracking. Provide detailed method definitions and docstrings to ensure clarity and consistency in broker implementations.

Enhance TradingEngine with market data provider integration
Add support for historical and live bar subscriptions in the TradingEngine using a MarketDataProvider. Implement subscription methods for strategies, including seamless historical-to-live transitions, and integrate MessageBus for distributing market data events. Update Strategy base class to delegate market data requests to TradingEngine. Modify `NewBarEvent` to include the `is_historical` flag for data context awareness. Add comprehensive testing with a mock provider in `test_playground.py` for validation.

Add broker management to TradingEngine
Implement broker registration, removal, and query methods in TradingEngine to manage multiple brokers. Add order management methods to delegate order operations (submit, cancel, modify) and retrieval of active orders to the appropriate broker. Update `TODO_steps.md` to mark Step 2.2 as complete.

Enhance `publish_bar` method in `TradingEngine` to include the `is_historical` flags
Update `TODO_steps.md` to mark Step 2.3 as completed. Enhance `publish_bar` method in `TradingEngine` to include the `is_historical` flag for distinguishing historical and live bar events. Modify the method to wrap bars in `NewBarEvent` for proper context awareness and publish the event via MessageBus.

Add market data handling methods to Strategy base class
Introduce `get_historical_bars_series`, `stream_historical_bars`, and bar subscription methods in the Strategy base class. These delegate historical and live bar data operations to the TradingEngine, enabling streamlined market data handling for strategies.

Mark Step 3.1 as completed in `TODO_steps.md`
Update `TODO_steps.md` to reflect the completion of Step 3.1: Adding market data request methods to the Strategy base class.
Base Strategy - add `is_historical` attribute to market-data related functions

Add order related methods in Strategy and remove tick-level methods
Eliminate trade tick and quote tick subscription methods, events, and handlers from the Strategy base class and TradingEngine. Introduce order management methods (submit, cancel, modify) and active orders retrieval in the Strategy base class, delegating operations to TradingEngine for streamlined broker interaction.

Add order related methods in Strategy and remove tick-level methods
Eliminate trade tick and quote tick subscription methods, events, and handlers from the Strategy base class and TradingEngine. Introduce order management methods (submit, cancel, modify) and active orders retrieval in the Strategy base class, delegating operations to TradingEngine for streamlined broker interaction.

Introduce support for multiple `MarketDataProvider` instances
Replace the single provider approach with a system allowing multiple `MarketDataProvider` instances to be registered, retrieved, and managed independently in `TradingEngine`. Update Strategy methods and TradingEngine functions to require an explicit provider, ensuring flexible data handling. Remove the optional `until_dt` parameter in favor of explicit data ranges. Delete `TODO_steps.md` as the implementation plan is no longer required.

Introduce support for multiple `MarketDataProvider` instances
Replace the single provider approach with a system allowing multiple `MarketDataProvider` instances to be registered, retrieved, and managed independently in `TradingEngine`. Update Strategy methods and TradingEngine functions to require an explicit provider, ensuring flexible data handling. Remove the optional `until_dt` parameter in favor of explicit data ranges. Delete `TODO_steps.md` as the implementation plan is no longer required.

Sync Junie guidelines into `CLAUDE.md`
Enhance `CLAUDE.md` with detailed principles, naming conventions, documentation styles, and import structure rules to improve clarity, maintainability, and consistency. Add practical examples for key guidelines, including user-centric design decisions, naming clarity, code formatting, and Markdown standards.

Overhaul `MarketDataProvider` interface and Strategy's market data handling
Redesign `MarketDataProvider` interface to support a broader event-based data model. Replace bar-specific methods with generic event-based methods, including support for historical and live data streaming. Update Strategy to handle a wide range of event types, with robust subscription and cleanup tracking. Enhance `TopicFactory` to dynamically generate topics for any event type based on request details. Introduce streamlined subscription management and provider delegation in `TradingEngine`.

Rename streaming methods for clarity and consistency
Update live event streaming method names across `MarketDataProvider`, `TradingEngine`, and `Strategy` to improve readability and align with naming guidelines. Changes include replacing `start_streaming_live_events` with `start_live_stream` and similar adjustments for related methods. Update corresponding exceptions and comments for the new names.

Simplify and clarify docstrings in `MarketDataProvider`
Refine method descriptions in `MarketDataProvider` to improve readability and consistency. Update docstrings for connection management, event handling, and streaming methods with concise and clear language to align with project documentation standards.

Add custom exceptions for unsupported event types and configurations
Introduce `UnsupportedEventTypeError` and `UnsupportedConfigurationError` to improve error handling in `MarketDataProvider`. Replace capability validation logic with these exceptions in `TradingEngine` for consistency and clarity. Update method docstrings accordingly to document the new exceptions.

Rename `request_details` to `parameters` for consistency and clarity
Replace usage of `request_details` with `parameters` across `MarketDataProvider`, `TradingEngine`, and `Strategy` to better reflect the nature of the data being passed. Update related docstrings, method signatures, and references in all relevant files to maintain consistency across the codebase.

Reorganize and simplify sections in `TradingEngine`
Refactor `TradingEngine` by renaming region headers for clarity, grouping related methods under cohesive sections, and simplifying utility and helper method placement. Restore and relocate removed methods like `_make_parameters_key`, `_generate_topic`, and `publish_bar` to enhance usability.

Rename region headers in `TopicFactory` for clarity
Update region headers in `TopicFactory` to better reflect their purpose, making them more descriptive and aligned with their functionality. Changes include renaming headers for core utility methods, market data topic creation, and event topic creation. No functional changes made.

Rename and reorganize region headers in `Strategy` for clarity
Update and reorder region headers across `Strategy` to enhance readability and logical grouping. Add missing regions, rename existing ones for more accurate descriptions, and relocate `_make_parameters_key` to helper methods. No functional changes made.

Add code organization guidelines with regions to Junie guidelines
Introduce a new section in the guidelines emphasizing the use of regions for organizing code in large files. Provide detailed rules, examples, and best practices to maintain clarity and structure in files exceeding 100 lines or containing multiple logical sections.

Remove unused BarType import and simplify subscription comments in TradingEngine
Clean up redundant code by removing the unused `BarType` import. Consolidate and clarify comments for subscription tracking variables to improve readability and maintain consistency. No functional changes made.

Switch `strategies` to a dictionary for better lookup and management
Update `TradingEngine` to use a dictionary for strategy registration, keyed by strategy names, improving retrieval and uniqueness enforcement. Refactor related methods (`add_strategy`, `remove_strategy`) to accommodate the new structure. Update loops and adjust docstrings for consistency.

Introduce `get_unique_name` method for better instance identification
Add the `get_unique_name` method to `Strategy`, `Broker`, and `MarketDataProvider` classes to ensure unique and stable instance identifiers. Refactor `TradingEngine` to utilize these methods for registering and managing strategies, brokers, and market data providers. Update related methods and exception messages to use the new approach, simplifying and standardizing name handling.

Add initial development mode guidelines to Junie guidelines
Introduce a new section outlining rules and principles for initial development mode, prioritizing rapid iteration and improvement over compatibility. Specify allowances for breaking changes, API redesigns, and other adjustments to establish a solid foundation for the library.

Reorganize regions in `Strategy` for improved clarity and structure
Renamed and rearranged region headers in `Strategy` to better reflect method group purposes. Restored and relocated internal methods like `_set_trading_engine` and `_distribute_event_to_specific_callbacks` to appropriate sections. No functional changes made.

Provide breakdown of market data issues and potential solutions in `TODO.md`
Replace the executive summary with a detailed explanation of the challenges in market data timing, including examples of how data ordering issues affect trading strategy logic. Add a structured analysis of the problem, its root causes, and requirements for a robust solution, introducing the concept of strategy clocks and synchronized timelines.

Rename `base.py` to `strategy.py` for improved clarity and intent
Replace references to `suite_trading.strategy.base` with `suite_trading.strategy.strategy` across the codebase, reflecting the role and focus of the file. Update imports in `test_playground` and `TradingEngine` for consistency.

Update `TODO.md` with a detailed breakdown of market data handling issues and solution proposals
Refine the problem explanation, add clear headers, and provide an in-depth perspective on challenges with market data timing. Introduce potential solutions like strategy clocks, event feeds, and timeline synchronization to ensure chronological consistency. Expand on implementation details and planned updates for better clarity.

Make `on_event` an abstract method in `Strategy`
Mark `on_event` as an abstract method, enforcing its implementation in all subclasses. Remove redundant event handling methods and internal routing logic (`_distribute_event_to_specific_callbacks`), simplifying the base class. Streamline event processing by centralizing handling in `on_event`.

Make `on_event` an abstract method to enforce implementation
Ensure all strategies handle events explicitly by marking `on_event` as abstract. Prevent silent failures and improve subclass consistency.

Remove market-data handling methods from TradingEngine + MarketDataProvider
Reason is, that the whole functionality is being redesigned.

Replace object self-naming with user-provided naming in TradingEngine
- Change add_strategy(), add_broker(), add_market_data_provider() to require user-provided names - Remove get_unique_name() methods from Strategy, Broker, and MarketDataProvider protocols - Update remove methods to accept name strings instead of object instances - Improve error messages with clear guidance for name conflicts - Update integration tests to use new naming approach
This breaking change improves API transparency by making object registration explicit and allows users to choose business-meaningful names for better debugging and maintenance.
BREAKING CHANGE: All TradingEngine add/remove methods now require explicit naming

Redesign and simplify market-data handling with 2 simple methods
- Strategy.add_event_feed(...) - Strategy.remove_event_feed(...)
Add request/cancel API for market data event delivery across Strategy–Engine–Provider
Add new request/cancel API for market data event delivery across Strategy–Engine–Provider

Reorder params in Strategy.request_event_delivery
- Make callback keyword-only, optional; default to on_event - Mirror
Adopt EventFeedProvider naming in TradingEngine

Simplify EventFeed: drop connect API, add close()
- Remove connect() and is_connected() from EventFeed protocol - Replace disconnect() with a single idempotent close() - Update docstrings and usage examples to reflect ready-to-use feeds - Keep next() and is_finished() as the core surface
Clarify EventFeed docs
Add state to the Strategy
Add defensive check comments standard and apply across codebase

Implement StateMachine for Strategy state management
- Add strategy_state_machine.py with StrategyState, StrategyAction enums and factory - Replace manual state management with StateMachine in Strategy and TradingEngine - Use descriptive action names (ADD_STRATEGY_TO_ENGINE, START_STRATEGY, etc.) - Remove old strategy_state.py file - Improve error messages with valid actions context

MESSAGE.value:
Simplify subscription management in `TradingEngine`
Remove unused `BarType` and `bar_subscriptions`. Streamlined and condensed event subscription tracking logic to improve readability and maintenance. No functional changes made.

Simplify subscription management and remove unused imports in `TradingEngine`
Refactor subscription-related attributes in `TradingEngine` to streamline implementation and improve clarity. Remove subscription tracking for unused `BarType`. Eliminate redundant code and unused imports to improve maintainability and readability.

Remove unused BarType import and simplify subscription comments in TradingEngine
Clean up redundant code by removing the unused `BarType` import. Consolidate and clarify comments for subscription tracking variables to improve readability and maintain consistency. No functional changes made.

Switch `strategies` to a dictionary for better lookup and management
Update `TradingEngine` to use a dictionary for strategy registration, keyed by strategy names, improving retrieval and uniqueness enforcement. Refactor related methods (`add_strategy`, `remove_strategy`) to accommodate the new structure. Update loops and adjust docstrings for consistency.

Introduce `get_unique_name` method for better instance identification
Add the `get_unique_name` method to `Strategy`, `Broker`, and `MarketDataProvider` classes to ensure unique and stable instance identifiers. Refactor `TradingEngine` to utilize these methods for registering and managing strategies, brokers, and market data providers. Update related methods and exception messages to use the new approach, simplifying and standardizing name handling.

Add guidelines for initial development mode
Introduce a new section in the guidelines outlining the rules and rationale for ignoring backwards compatibility during the initial development phase. Emphasize rapid iteration, breaking changes, and prioritizing the best user experience over stability to build a strong foundation. Specify the temporary nature of these rules and the shift towards stability in later phases.

Add initial development mode guidelines to Junie guidelines
Introduce a new section outlining rules and principles for initial development mode, prioritizing rapid iteration and improvement over compatibility. Specify allowances for breaking changes, API redesigns, and other adjustments to establish a solid foundation for the library.

Reorganize regions in `Strategy` for improved clarity and structure
Renamed and rearranged region headers in `Strategy` to better reflect method group purposes. Restored and relocated internal methods like `_set_trading_engine` and `_distribute_event_to_specific_callbacks` to appropriate sections. No functional changes made.

Provide breakdown of market data issues and potential solutions in `TODO.md`
Replace the executive summary with a detailed explanation of the challenges in market data timing, including examples of how data ordering issues affect trading strategy logic. Add a structured analysis of the problem, its root causes, and requirements for a robust solution, introducing the concept of strategy clocks and synchronized timelines.

Rename `base.py` to `strategy.py` for improved clarity and intent
Replace references to `suite_trading.strategy.base` with `suite_trading.strategy.strategy` across the codebase, reflecting the role and focus of the file. Update imports in `test_playground` and `TradingEngine` for consistency.

Introduce potential solutions like strategy clocks, event feeds, and timeline synchronization to ensure chronological consistency. Expand on implementation details and planned updates for better clarity.

Mark `on_event` as an abstract method, enforcing its implementation in all subclasses. Remove redundant event handling methods and internal routing logic (`_distribute_event_to_specific_callbacks`), simplifying the base class. Streamline event processing by centralizing handling in `on_event`.

Make `on_event` an abstract method to enforce implementation
Ensure all strategies handle events explicitly by marking `on_event` as abstract. Prevent silent failures and improve subclass consistency.

Remove market-data handling methods from TradingEngine + MarketDataProvider
Reason is, that the whole functionality is being redesigned.

Replace object self-naming with user-provided naming in TradingEngine
- Change add_strategy(), add_broker(), add_market_data_provider() to require user-provided names - Remove get_unique_name() methods from Strategy, Broker, and MarketDataProvider protocols - Update remove methods to accept name strings instead of object instances - Improve error messages with clear guidance for name conflicts - Update integration tests to use new naming approach
This breaking change improves API transparency by making object registration explicit and allows users to choose business-meaningful names for better debugging and maintenance.
BREAKING CHANGE: All TradingEngine add/remove methods now require explicit naming

Redesign and simplify market-data handling with 2 simple methods
- Strategy.add_event_feed(...) - Strategy.remove_event_feed(...)
Add request/cancel API for market data event delivery across Strategy–Engine–Provider
Add new request/cancel API for market data event delivery across Strategy–Engine–Provider

Reorder params in Strategy.request_event_delivery
- Make callback keyword-only, optional; default to on_event - Mirror
Adopt EventFeedProvider naming in TradingEngine

Simplify EventFeed: drop connect API, add close()
- Remove connect() and is_connected() from EventFeed protocol - Replace disconnect() with a single idempotent close() - Update docstrings and usage examples to reflect ready-to-use feeds - Keep next() and is_finished() as the core surface
Clarify EventFeed docs

option.value:
Implement StateMachine for Strategy state management
- Add strategy_state_machine.py with StrategyState, StrategyAction enums and factory - Replace manual state management with StateMachine in Strategy and TradingEngine - Use descriptive action names (ADD_STRATEGY_TO_ENGINE, START_STRATEGY, etc.) - Remove old strategy_state.py file - Improve error messages with valid actions context
